summary: This is an email chain discussing the confidential plea agreement with Jeffrey Epstein, specifically addressing whether victims (Jane Does) were properly notified about the plea negotiations as required by Attorney General guidelines. The email indicates an agreement has been signed and partially performed, and raises questions about potential prosecutorial misconduct.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the plea agreement being discussed; his lawyers are mentioned as claiming prosecutorial misconduct.

events.title: Email Discussion of Epstein Plea Agreement
events.description: Email correspondence discussing the signed confidential plea agreement with Jeffrey Epstein and questions about victim notification prior to the agreement.

keyFacts: A confidential plea agreement with Jeffrey Epstein had been signed and was already partially performed as of July 2008.
The agreement was filed under seal in state court proceedings.
Epstein's lawyers claimed prosecutorial misconduct after a Jane Doe was notified about the agreement.
The email references Attorney General guidelines requiring notification of victims about prospective plea negotiations.
There was uncertainty about whether a third Jane Doe was notified prior to the signing of the agreement.
